title: Energy Data Analytics Dashboard - Student Version
text: eDASH can accessed many different way depending user. provide online version base users can access service software requirements, local access installing dashboard R package intermediate finally version control installation developer contributors.

title: Energy Data Analytics Dashboard - Student Version
text: link possible access use dashboard online without R Rstudio installed computer. Thanks shinyapps.io whole application hosted online accessible without requirements internet connection. Warning: Since online hosting performed free account, limit 25 active hours set server. limit exceded app available untill next month cycle. Therefore, suggest exploit dashboard functionalities cloning repository local machines explained following.

title: Energy Data Analytics Dashboard - Student Version
text: kind installation suitable permission download code want run dashboard locally R package. Since code hosted private GitHub repository user must permissions Install development version GitHub : can run application simply typing console:

title: Energy Data Analytics Dashboard - Student Version
text: kind installation suitable developers permission access private GitHub repository download full code. process described allows get whole GitHub repository computer. sure latest version RStudio installed, follow steps: RStudio, start new Project following path “File > New Project > Version Control > Git”; “Repository URL”, paste URL https://github.com/baeda-polito/dashboard-student; Accept default “Project directory name” coincides GitHub repo name dashboard-student; Chose local path save repository computer; Click “Create Project”. Now cloned repository can contribute!

title: Energy Data Analytics Dashboard - Student Version
text: contributions make greatly appreciated. want propose feature report bug please open new issue. want contribute code, follow steps: Create Feature Branch, called example MYBRANCH (git     checkout -b feature/MYBRANCH); Commit Changes (git commit -m 'Add AmazingFeature'); Push Branch (git push origin feature/MYBRANCH); Open Pull Request. project follow defined convection branch names, please follow . main branch called main online branch. want contribute one module example clustering module, please call branch.

what: Building electrical load time series — data
title: Building electrical load time series — data
text: dataset containing building electrical load time series climatic data. refers electrical substation university campus. total electrical load denoted variable "Total_Power" sum "Allocated" "Not_allocated" load. "Allocated" load turn sum remaining loads.

title: Building electrical load time series — data
Building electrical load time series — data
text: data frame 69687 rows 15 variables: Date_Time Central European Time yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS, character ToU Time Use (F1/F2/F3), factor Total_Power Average Electrical Power (kW)  substation, numeric Chiller Average Electrical Power (kW)  mechanical room, numeric Hglobal Average global radiation (W/m2), numeric Text Average external air temperature (C), numeric

title: Building electrical load time series — data
text: http://www.baeda.polito./

title: Run the Shiny Application — run_app
code: run_app(onStart = NULL, options = list(), enableBookmarking = NULL, ...)

title: Run the Shiny Application — run_app
text: onStart function called app actually run. needed shinyAppObj, since shinyAppDir case, global.R file can used purpose. options Named options passed runApp call (can following: "port", "launch.browser", "host", "quiet", "display.mode" "test.mode"). can also specify width height parameters provide hint embedding environment ideal height/width app. enableBookmarking Can one "url", "server", "disable". default value, NULL, respect setting previous calls  enableBookmarking(). See enableBookmarking() information bookmarking app. ... arguments pass golem_opts

text: Normalizes z score

title: Z score normalization — zscore
Z score normalization — zscore
text: x Input variable na.rm TRUE missing values removed calculation

title: Z score normalization — zscore
text: x numeric variable return (x - mean(x)) / sd(x)

title: Z score normalization — zscore
code: if (FALSE) { x <- data$Total_Power x_zscore <- zscore(x) x }
